text:
I am delighted to share a review of my mother's gallbladder surgery, which was a resounding success. Prior to the procedure, my mother experienced debilitating pain and discomfort due to gallstones, impacting her daily life and overall well-being. However, thanks to the expertise of the surgical team (Dr. Satyajit Rath) and the advancements in medical technology, the surgery was performed with precision and care. From the initial consultation to the post-operative care, the medical team provided exceptional support and guidance, alleviating any concerns we had. The surgeon thoroughly explained the procedure and its potential risks, ensuring that my mother felt informed and confident in her decision.

On the day of the surgery, everything proceeded smoothly, and my mother was made comfortable throughout the entire process. The minimally invasive approach significantly reduced recovery time and post-operative pain, allowing my mother to return home sooner than anticipated. The post-operative care instructions provided by the medical team were clear and concise, enabling us to support my mother's recovery effectively.

Now, several weeks post-surgery, my mother is back to her usual self, enjoying activities she once struggled with due to gallbladder issues. The success of the surgery has not only restored my mother's health but also brought immense peace of mind to our family.

In conclusion, I am immensely grateful to the surgical team of Sum Ultimate Medicare for their expertise and compassion throughout my mother's gallbladder surgery journey. Their dedication to excellence has truly transformed my mother's life for the better, and we couldn't be more thankful for the successful outcome.
name: Rabindra Rg
title: SUM Ultimate Medicare - Best Multispeciality Hospital in Bhubaneswar

text:
Respected Sir/Mam,

I am a Army person husband of Sanjita Rina Khalko who is being treated under Dr. Unmesh Kumar Jena for Road accident crush injury of hand and leg.
Pt had come in a serious condition with ventilator support with severe infection and  was excellently managed by Dr Jena with prompt surgeries and resuscitation.
The left leg was in a very bad condition where in outside hospital it was told to amputate completely, However with good dressing by Biswajit dresser bhai, regular VAC therapy and timely intervention by Dr Itishree mam and all  team members of  Dear Dr. Jena sir for a fabulous job for saving the limb further.
Once we had decided to take away the patient due to monetary  issues initially before 12 days  but stayed back trusting the hospital and Dr Jena's commitment to heal and save the limbs further. Now she is completely fine, doing well and wound is healing faster and we are getting discharged from the hospital tommorrow.
Now we are happy that we didn't regret our decision to shift to Army Hospital, Kolkata inspite of all  free treatment there.

Thank you sir for being supportive to army staffs and their family as well..
My wife's good wishes and  blessings for all... 🙏

Mr.Manoj Khalko,
Army officer
name: Manoj Khalkho
title: SUM Ultimate Medicare - Best Multispeciality Hospital in Bhubaneswar

I had a very bad experience recently when my patient was admitted for treatment. I had called at 11pm on 02.07.2024 for ambulance service to take the patient. When I called the hospital, Mr. Umesh Ku Jena who called himself the Manager said that I have to arrange my own people to carry the patient. Further, extra money was demanded for carrying the patient and finally the ambulance went back within 10 mins without the patient. When I called the hospital again, Mr. Jena alleged that patient denied to come  which was clearly not the case and even went on to say that you can complain to whosoever you want. The ambulance went back immediately after my conversation with Mr. Jena.
So i was forced to travel and upon reaching the next morning, I admitted the patient.
I only request that the hospital have an efficient service where no patient is denied Healthcare as per wish of the hospital personnel especially at such late night.

text: ❌Never a patient should go to this hospital. They have only money making policy. None of them is adequately trained. My patient was admitted twice in the emergency (as they don't have any day care facilities), both the time we saw unhealthy dirty emergency room, No covid protocol ,no BMW protocol is being maintained there. But, They are charging for infection control. One have to pay appx 6k for only one medicine infusion n emergency bed charge,where patient bought their injection from outside. No monitoring of patients vitals, no record of patients condition, no treatment record they maintained. Patient relative only get's the hospital bill, nothing else . Even they asked for medicine bill which was bought from outside, I don't know what is the function of that bill for administration of a drug.. Even they forcefully make us purchased few medicine from them inspite of having the same drug from outside, I don't know wheather they know the drug calculation or not. Disgusting hospital and disgusting untrained employees.

title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

That time casualties staff as doctor, nurses are very good. They took immediate action to overcome on problem and gave injection and sline. Due to accountability of staff's, I temporary felt relax.
But during that time, nurses called Dr. Smita many times, but not received the call. About 7:30 AM she received the call of staff and denied to come. But casualties doctor and nurses requesting many times. They told to me for requesting to come and help in treatment. I talked but she denied to come and told for consult with other hospital. My timing is from 12 pm. She is very insensitive.
Then I went other hospital at 8:30 AM.

text:
This is a relatively small but  good hospital for any general or specialised health care requirement .

This speciality of the hospital is the AOI(oncology) unit that cater to the holistic needs and render exclusive best in class treatment for various types of cancer patients. To their credit they have one of the best and experienced doctors of medical oncology in our state as well as eastern India  Dr Ghanshyam  Biswas sir who is leading and mentoring it treating thousands of patients with his expertise. All the doctors under him are sincere ,compassionate ,caring and attentive to the patients. The nursing staff are courteous ,professional ,skillfull ,well spoken so as the supporting staffs profesional in handling queries and counselling. would strongly recommend anybody needing support in the field of medical oncology should get advise or treated here .Any ways there are always scope for improving and I sincerely hope they keep improving and garner more trust and efficiency in coming days . Thanks

text: We recently experienced exceptional care at Apollo Hospital during a hip joint surgery. title: SUM Hospital

text:
This hospital is equipped with modern equipments, technologies and laboratories. Sufficient amount of doctors are there for treatment but are not available all round the day. Treatment is up to the mark but for many small cases, they usually refer to do certain types of tests from their laboratories so that they get assure from those reports. Originally, these are all the methods of making handsome amount of money.

Coming to the emergency unit, it is OK.

Coming to the various wards , where patients stay for treatment are equipped with everything possible and are CLEAN.
But if somebody is admitted to any ward they try to stretch the days so that the patient stays for quite many days and so that the hospital makes much money from the patient through medicines and various tests.

Coming to medicines, if the patient is admitted in the hospital, then it is mandatory to buy medicines from their stores present in the ground floor and in the 4th floor.

And the lab tests are to be done there only as per the suggestions of the hospitals.

If medicines are to be bought for an admitted patient , then it is also mandatory to prepay a large amount of sum so that the medicines amount are deducted from that already paid amount.

Hospital staffs ( including doctors, nurses, and room attendants) : Some are hospitable, friendly and also some are impatient .

There is a canteen where everyone can eat and there is also the facility of serving food up to the patients in their respective rooms or wards which have to be prepaid.

It is mandatory that one should be with an indoor patient (may it be from his/her family, or friend) who will do the similar work of an attendant.

Medical students also come here often for their practicals. The students are from their medical college.

Crowdy place 9:00 am onwards.

Parking near the hospital : For two wheeler ,  Rs. 10 is charged . For four wheelers there is no such parking lot or structure avilable right now. You can simply park it near any side of the road. But I heard that a parking lot  is being constructed for this parking problem infront of the hospital.

Please don't get admit if it's not a too much serious case, or they (hospital authorities) will not let you go until they make sufficient money from you.

Apart from these , the difference that it makes from other private hospitals is that the bed charge is not charged from indoor or admitted patients.

It also has an ATM booth of Punjab National Bank inside. Ambulance services are also available.

Tip: What I had experienced , the 'Department of Opthalmology' (where  eye treatment is done) is good.

If you really put your time to read this completely, then I  think that I have not left anything above to mention that can put you in trouble .
name: Sri Sankalpa Mishra
title: SUM Hospital

text:
New Super Speciality hospital building from SUM hospital. It is next to the existing SUM hospital.

This is fully air conditioned and offers most of the treatment like Cardiology, Neuro, Orthopaedic, Nephro so on ..It has emergency casuality section setup. However the service provider is not up to par for the price they are charging. Lack of experience staff in ICU and Casuality ward is concerning. Nursing and care giver are young and inexperienced. Room charge is too expensive. Overall experience is not good. Look for other super speciality hospital if you can.

Long time is taken in dealing with Insurance and IPD billing section. Tiering experience.

Canteen is available on ground floor for Breakfast, Lunch and dinner. Lunch has both Veg & Non-vegetarian food. Self service and do Check the price before buying. You can have other fast food items too. Go during time as food availability is limited.
name: Santosh Panda
title: SUM Ultimate Medicare - Best Multispeciality Hospital in Bhubaneswar

title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text:
I was for the cancer treatment (Hodgkin lymphoma) almost for a year at Sparsh Hospital.
Initially I was diagnosed in Bangalore in April 2017 when I  had a small lump at the groin area. We thought of taking the treatment in Bhubaneswar as it was our hometown. I remember I was undergone with counseling by Dr. Ghanshyam Biswass. Who gave me support and assurance that the treatment would go smoothly. His healing kind of words gave me courage.
I remember on 3rd may I had my 1st chemo.  Followed by 11 more with in a span of 6-7 months. Followed by radiations and With regular check ups. During these days I came across lots of physical as well as mental or psychological pain which can't be expressed.
But anyways... coming to the service and hospitality, the staff or Nurses at Sparsh were extremely professional, skilled, helpful, give such care like no other hospitals as per my knowledge. They speak like a patient's own family members. That's a great difference I found at Sparsh Hospital. At Sparsh Hospital everything is taken care of whether it may be quality of food, hygiene, or services.
Nutritionist, Rout mam, she guided me with all my food intake as well as with hygiene. A lot to learn from her. Quite informative, and experienced.

So I want to conclude that I am very much satisfied with the attention, care, and treatment which Sparsh Hospital Bhubaneswar provides to the patients.

"It's not for promotion but it is out of my experience."

May GOD bless everyone.
Jai Jagannath !
name: Subhransu Sekhar Patra
title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text:
I don’t know how to write about this hospital.
I will highlight my 14days experience and I lost my mother and she had stone in gall bladder.
-Pathetic service
-11beds inside ICU and hardly 2-3 inexperience nurses to take care all patients
-One doctor in ICU for 12hrs possible passed out from college -doesn’t looks experienced at all
-No experienced surgeons  are working here
-Prime moto of this hospital bring a patient and put him in ICU and it is money-sucking .....
-Staffs starting from reception,insurance,admin...very very unprofessional.
-Only one thing I can say “Don’t admit any one in this hospital and more precisely NO NO NO if you need any surgery/Operation from them”.
-My mother passed away around 10PM and they did’t give me clearance because final settlement was not done as she was covered through insurance.However I requested them “I will submit a check and if there is any difficulty from indurance can deduct from check and simple answer was NO”.Next day morning they started processing file after 11am and I finally got clearance to take the body around 2.30PM.
-They billed nearly 4.5Lakhs .
-I myself feal guilty “She could have cured,if I choose some better facility hospital “.

The sad part is all private hospitals in Bhubaneswar are simple running by advertisement ,free medical camp and by putting few ministers photos with lots of appreciation merely simple lie.Don’t go with fancy words,touts recommendation.
Always take 2nd,3rd experienced doctor’s opinion and then choose best hospital.
Thanks
name: Daya Panda
title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text: I have really very bad experience .... my father had mouth cancer,he had swollen face and he was in intense pain ... so I searched online and came to know about Doctor Ghanshyam Biswas  who has earn awards also for his work. Thus with much hope I came to him ,I thought he can only help me and can cure my father  from pain . I met him ,I have my father's reports with me and entered his chamber. In a very rude tone he asked me what do u want and I told him about my father's health history. But he was not in a mood to listen he just keep on saying what do u want then i asked him to suggest something to relieve my father from intense pain he directly denied me saying  "Doctor Ghanshyam is not  for taking care and giving support, if u want support and care then visit some other hospitals, if u want chemo then come here".. I was like speechless and with tears in my eyes I walked away.  How could a doctor be so rude to his customer? He could have politely speak to me and atleast could have once checked my reports and then suggest something in a polite manner. Really I dont know why he has so much attitude. But sir if u will come across my review anytime then i just want to say thank you that u denied me ... after u denied only  I visited Amri hospital and had my father's surgery there and Amri doctors are so humble and nice that they cured my father  and now my father is able to eat again ,he has no pain.

text:
"I recently had a surgery at Care Hospital Bhubaneswar, and I couldn't have been more impressed with the entire experience. The doctor( Dr. Jatashankar mahapatra and her team)who performed my surgery was absolutely fantastic. They were highly skilled and knowledgeable, and they took the time to answer all of my questions and put my mind at ease before the procedure. Throughout my recovery, they were attentive and provided me with excellent care.

The hospital staff was also exceptional. From the moment I arrived, everyone was kind, compassionate, and professional. They went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and ensure that I had everything I needed. The nurses were particularly outstanding. They were incredibly attentive and always available to help, even during the busiest times.

Lastly, the management team at Care Hospital Bhubaneswar should be commended for running such a well-organized and efficient facility. The hospital was clean and well-maintained, and I never had to wait long for my appointments or tests. It's clear that the team at Care Hospital Bhubaneswar truly cares about their patients and their well-being.

Overall, I highly recommend Care Hospital Bhubaneswar for anyone in need of medical care. The doctor, staff, and management team are all exceptional, and I couldn't have asked for a better experience."
name: Ritik Sahu
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

Total staff of the preliminary officiating, canteen management, immediate personnels to Doctors, medical testings, ECG/ECHO stand-by representatives with respective radiologists are stupendously praiseworthy. I cannot wave the Care Hospital so far   as the miraculous hospitality is concerned. My sincere experience since 8 years(2016-23) is highly commendable. Other than cardilogy, other faculty captains are similarly beyond teething. The extraordinary personality with alluring  gossips of my esteemed dr. title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
I visited Dr. Debabrata Panigrahi (ENT) specialist today, for checking the ears of my 3 year old daughter.
I would say that Dr, Panigrahi was not really professional enough. Please find below my impressions about the doctor.

1. Behavior: As he seems to be a senior doctor, I expected him to me very polite, and friendly, however, that was not the case.
Also, I don't understand why doctors get offended, when the patients ask questions regarding the medicines. When I asked him about the composition of the medicines he had prescribed, he seemed to get offended.

2. Diagnostic: He just checked both the ears of my daughter,  using a torch for a few seconds, and concluded that it was ear infection, and prescribed some medicines including an antibiotic (amoxycillin), even though there was no sign of any infection, or any liquid deposition in the ear.
When I told him to clean the ear, he avoided it, and told to complete the medication, and come back after a week.
I mean, he being a senior doctor, I expect him to be more proactive in diagnosing the problem, rather than jumping to conclusion.
After coming back home, I checked the ears carefully, and was able to remove a hardened ear wax.
My point is that the doctor had all the required equipments, and he could have easily checked and cleaned the ears, and there would have been no need of the antibiotics prescribed.

So, disappointed this time, as I often visit Dr. Mamata Panda, at Care, and she seems to be a great doctor.
name: sandeep Kumar
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
I would like share my own experience about Sunshine hospital that i hope its only no-1 worst hospital in bhubneswar, i was doing treatment of my father who if brain stroke patients from 8 months, he was well from last 8 months by treatment other hospital but unfortunately due head pain and sleeping issue i visit dr Payod kumar jena, however he asked to diagnose lot of tests like -MRI, blood tests many more then he prescribed the same old medicine and as to visit after 5 days.
My father health not even littile improve after 5 days. Again i came and visit dr payod jena he simply suggested for admission. I did admission but some other dr name Tanmay padhi was doing treatment from 4/5 days but patients health was bad conditions day by day.. When i came to know that the drugs were no changes to his issues.. Simply they were giving paracetamol, gas medicine and hard dose sleeping piles 25 mg and blod pressure drugs which earlier used to.
I requested them kindly let me know what cause.. They simply say be stay here 10/ 15 days then your patient will be improve... Every day we met patient and see his healt conditions is going to bad since there is no good doctor know about nurology i hope..Simply may got a degree. finally i requested to discharge howver very hardly they got agree but took a complete day till evening and they did unnecessary MRI scan again without informing me while no doctors there to see report till night. What a nonsense stafs are there i feel very bad in my life in that hospital.The hospital is only for money purpose seems,  Even i observed other patients situation also same all other patients attendor saying..
After discharged of my fatyer i saw all drugs which they given for five days dose are paracetamol, gas tablets, hard dose 25 mg sleeping pils and blood presure medicine which i used to.

I would recommend never go to that hospital if you realy wants your patients to be well.

text:
Major General SD Mahanti, VSM
I'm almost there becoming an Octogenarian Army Veteran having served Nation for almost 4 dcades. I'm of high co-morbity lot.
11 Mar 2021
The day before I was asked to report at the Sparsh Hospital Vaccination Centre with Adhar Card only preregistration have been done on line. Numerous advivces, none from the Hosital, came that I must there on time etc etc lest should I miss my turn, I will have to keep playing 'SNAKES & LADDER' rest of
day. So bang at 0920 I was there at the gate with my daughter.
0930 I was inside an excellently appointed chamber, neatest ever upto high military standards, no loitering about of the supporting staff. And ...and most cheerful nursing  lady executives bejewelled with the dazzling, glittering smiles. From the through the obversation area the 'thank you' door out, it was an experience of laughter & fun with a Grandfather.
God bless you caretaker girl-kids.
Thank you CEO Chinmoy Mohapatra for the Military like precision operation.
Now I look forwad to the 2nd Jab.
Do have a 3rd one, the 4th one?
I'm game even if is Distilled water just to experience the Sparsh fun.
name: Chinu Mahanti
title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text:
One of the key contributing factors to the compounding growth of “SPARSH HOSPITAL” has been its efficient operational management & meeting people's requirements. The organization under the leadership of DR. DHIR & DR. BISWAS has been successful in building a total solution to all the requirements of there patients. It has been done through forward and backward integration and various processes wherever required by introduction of innovative ideas.
The entire system is presently handled with a military precision and at present not only covers Bhubaneswar but also has plans to support the demand and new ventures across the city  both creating opportunity for all the  individual's and the community without any ambiguity.

In the present day one cannot over emphasize the importance of "QUALITY HOSPITALS & STAFFS"and DR. DHIR was early in recognizing the importance and putting place the right resources and creating what they have today for all the
individuals. For a person who handles more than several individual hopes with well defined projects and standards complimented by his team member’s has been a major factor in building up the relationship and faith among all of his patients and many more.

It has been Dr. Dhir’s dream to bring the entire concept to a next level where he can help people in every aspect.

“SPARSH HOSPITAL ” which is still evolving has been the major binding force that held the organization during the days of recession when many perished.

The “SPARSH” difference -

It has always been a question that I have wondered during my brain storming sessions as to what makes “SPARSH HOSPITAL” different from the others and I have agreed that it is the “VALUES”. The values that makes them responsible for all that they do and makes them answerable for there  actions. Dr. DHIR put’s this value behind his success and hence have grown from person to have build an empire and survived the rough days with ease.

At-last, I would like to thank DR. Swetaleena parija & DR. Sanjay jangid whom according to me are the pillars of Sparsh who’s effort and deification towards there profession is immense.
name: Kaushik
title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text:
Recently had my father undergone a stenting procedure.

Worst management and non-medical staffs thought nurses and the doctor were pretty good.
They charged 3.7 lakhs while initial estimate was 2.1 (~ +50 for extra stent). The logic was since we requested to upgrade to a single room for a day post ICU - they doubled the package from 70k to 1.4 lakh. They were clueless on what the package included and kept on fighting that the package is doubled while the single room rent was around 10k and no once told us about the package doubling. Btw OT, ICU, consultation were not part of the packages

Upon continued enquiry from us they concluded that it’s a IT issue and reduced the bill to 2.9 lakh. Imagine how helpless someone can be in this situation - thank god my family and friends were there.

Pathetic and near illegal, just because we had insurance and the audacity of the hospital staff to defend the initial bill.
name: Abhishek Das
title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text:
I remember when few years back, my wife had a serious fire burn in Diwali,  and many of the reputed hospitals in bhubaneswar refused to even admit her.
In that situation I was referred to by Ms Praksmita Rout,  who works as a Dietitian in sparsh, to move my wife to sparsh.
Without hesitation, I rushed there.
I was really happy when I saw a tremendous support from the sparsh team when I reached there.
They did all the essentials at the earliest.
Dr Jayant dash, who is a burn specialist, came immediately.
He did a marvelous treatment.
My wife was admitted for about 20/25 days.
The treatment and the attention given by the nurses, doctors, dietitian, support staffs, won my heart.
The treatment cost was also very economical.
I personally thanks Dr Dhir,  for running such a people friendly hospital in bhubaneswar.
Long live... SPARSH
name: Sujit Patnaik
title: Sparsh Hospitals & Critical Care Pvt. Ltd.

text: Dr. G.Biswas oncologist known to be the god has proven that God is one whom we can't see but we can feel. My mother was suffering from oral cancer. He studied the case and told that she will be cured and handed over the case to Dr. Rajesh Padhi Head and Neck surgeon. He operated my mother and told that he couldn't go farther to operate. Then he recommended again to G.Biswas. He referred to get the radiotherapy in kolkata. She got the therapy in kolkata and the doctor said that she is fine. Then again my mother went to bbsr for check up. They said everything is fine..after some days my mother's began to swell again and still they said that she is fine. Now my mother's cancer has come to last stage and I will loss her forever. They are fraud nothing else.

text:
I recently visited SUM ultimate, bhubaneswar for the application of a prosthetic, and I couldn't be more pleased with the experience. From the very beginning, Doctor S.K. Anuwar Ali treated me with the utmost respect and care. The entire process, which I was initially apprehensive about, was made smooth and comfortable thanks to his expertise and compassion.

Dr. S.K Anuwar Ali not only applied the prosthetic with great skill but also took the time to ensure I was comfortable and confident in its use. He patiently practiced with me, addressing all my concerns and questions with thorough explanations and demonstrations.

The level of care and attention to detail was truly exceptional. I am incredibly grateful for Dr S.K Anuwar Ali and the whole Dept of Prosthetic's dedication and would highly recommend him to anyone in need of prosthetic services. Thank you for making a significant difference in my life
name: manas panigrahi

text:
Worst doctors and worst experience at Care hospital. Because of Dr Subhranshu Jena and Dr Deepak Parida’s negligence, lack of attention, misdiagnosis our patient died. Do not ever consult them if you want your patient to survive. During our patient’s treatment both of them were on leave the entire time. We paid lakhs of money only to get treatment by nurses who again don’t even know how to interpret basic parameters, or anything about medicine, injections, bed side procedures. They function like robots. We were extremely concerned because we could see our patient was deteriorating in front of our eyes but the so called nurses and critical care doctors waited for more proof. We heavily regret having taken our patient to Care hospital, BBSR. Even the way critical care doctors interacted with us (family members) is unthinkable. They don’t know how to communicate correctly with concerned family members. They would harass and be harsh with my mom and us ( daughters) They never communicated about anything with us(family members) inspite of us asking about our patient’s deteriorating condition numerous times.

Care hospital, Bhubaneswar does not even have a decent neurologist or neurosurgeons. All are incompetent. All they care about is money. It’s a shame to even call that place a hospital.

Never go to Care and specifically to Dr Subhransu Jena or Deepak Parida or Mitalee Kar for any neurology related consultation. They are a shame in name of humanity. It’s a shame they call themselves doctors!
name: Isha Satyam
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
Had a nice experience during my dad’s treatment in this hospital.
Pros:
- Excellent ICU facilities. Absolutely top notch.
- Equipped with all modern facilities and instrument’s
- Prompt response from the Nurses across all the departments (ICU, HDU, Cabin)
- Very good house keeping service. Special thanks to Susil Sethi who helped us with all needs. He was very prompt at the time of need and shown a great deal of empathy. Thanks again to him for his brilliant service.
- Neat and clean rooms.
- Rooms being cleaned in regular interval of time.
- Worth to mention the quality of food available at the canteen for the attendants. Reasonable price and very good in taste and healthy as well. Not oily like street foods.
- Food is served for the patients at regular interval of time based on the diet chart prepared by dietician.
- Very good security.
Improvement:
- Definitely not a hospital for everyone considering the price of the treatment. But considering the kind if service they provide the price is worth.
- One thing I observed the overall cost of treatment could be reduced if the insurance amount could be spent little efficiently. I felt lot of extra charges getting applied in insurance which i think is the case of most of the corporate hospitals.
- There is a bit of lack in communication about the condition of patient when the patient is in ICU / HDU. This is definitely an area to be improved so that the relatives or near ones would be assured about the situation and can take informed decisions.
name: Santosh Kar
title: SUM Ultimate Medicare - Best Multispeciality Hospital in Bhubaneswar

text:
It provides undergraduate courses in medicine and dentistry, and postgraduate courses in non-clinical departments. It has begun providing post graduation in clinical subjects like surgery and anesthesia.
It provides speciality services including cardiology, neurology, nephrology, plastic surgery and neo-natalogy.
The IMS - Institute of Medical Sciences (the college wing) is a private medical college in the state of Odisha. It has six lecture theatres with e-teaching facilities. It has its own library with an internet cafe, and the campus has high-speed wi-fi facility.

text:
I am a MBBS who passed via this very institute, however , I state this so as to give a relatively unbiased view

PROS:
In terms of being a hospital , IMS & SUM is the best in providing super specialist services at affordable prices , with various government and other schemes also valid

Nearly every investigational procedures are available at the institute making it one of the best in the state

Some of the finest and biggest name in the state are employee to the hospital and serve tirelessly to cure the ailments.

As for being an institute , the faculty is one of the finest in state with a potent library , decent infrastructure , and good study structures

CONS:
However patient day to day care can be a bit lagging and sometimes may even be as callous as government colleges in the state

Although this is a private institute the overall behavior of staff and their responses can very well be rude at times , it's not corporate hospital like

OVERALL:
A fine institute and probably the only affordable multi speciality hospital , however patient care is lagging and can improve
name: Dr Rashmit Mishra

text: I have mixed experiences, I am providing this feedback for the  overall improvement in the healthcare management system of the hospital. Care hospital has a reputation because of its  doctors and most efficient supporting staff. Patient come to the hospital because of their long association with the  hospital and doctors. They have certain expectations in the matter of diagnosis, treatment and care, cost effectiveness, appropriate and quicker service. However still there are certain areas where the above mentioned qualities are yet to be functional. The hospital should take care of innovating skillful implementation of diagnostic perfection of the doctors which is hallmark of any treatment. Moreover Doctors need to be considerate over the financial position of the patient. Support team need to be empathetic to the situation of the patients. The management should look into the matter holistically to ensure hiring more skilled and responsible human resources to deliver appropriate healthcare to all.
name: Basav Mohapatra

text:
Kalinga Hospital Bhubaneswar is a well-established multi-specialty hospital with a reputation for experienced doctors and a wide range of services. Here are some of the strengths I found:

Multi-Specialty Care: Kalinga Hospital offers a comprehensive range of specialties, including cardiology, neurology, gastroenterology, urology, and more. This one-stop approach can be convenient for patients seeking treatment for various conditions.

Experienced Doctors: The hospital boasts a team of over 150 doctors, many with years of experience. This can provide patients with confidence in the level of care they will receive.

24/7 Emergency Care: Having access to a well-equipped emergency department is crucial during critical situations. Kalinga Hospital provides 24/7 emergency care, which can be lifesaving.

Positive Patient Experience: Based on user reviews, the hospital generally receives positive feedback on patient care. This can be a good indicator of the overall atmosphere and attentiveness of the staff.

Overall, Kalinga Hospital appears to be a strong option for those seeking quality healthcare in Bhubaneswar.
name: SUNIL BEHERA
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

text:
As a father, I am incredibly grateful for the outstanding care and guidance provided by Dr. Rashmi Hegde and Dr. Ankita Bhagat.

Dr. Rashmi Hegde, as my wife’s gynecologist, has been a pillar of support throughout her journey. Her expertise and compassionate approach made every consultation reassuring. She took the time to explain every detail, ensuring we were well-informed and comfortable with the treatment plan. Her timely availability and prompt responses to any concerns were truly commendable. Dr. Hegde's dedication to her patients' well-being is evident in the personalized care she provides, making her an exceptional doctor.

Dr. Ankita Bhagat, our pediatrician, has been equally remarkable. Her warm and friendly demeanor instantly puts children and parents at ease. She is thorough in her examinations and ensures that every aspect of our child's health is addressed. Her timely guidance and availability have been a great source of comfort, especially during emergencies. Dr. Bhagat's genuine care and commitment to her young patients' health and happiness make her an outstanding pediatrician.

Both Dr. Rashmi Hegde and Dr. Ankita Bhagat have made a significant positive impact on our family's lives through their exceptional medical expertise and compassionate care. I highly recommend them to anyone seeking top-notch medical care in their respective fields.
name: Subhashis Mohanty
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

text:
In an environment where bloodthirsty hospitals like Care demand that you first get supplies for your wounds from their pharmacy by paying up front (the severity of your condition doesn’t matter), Kalinga Hospital employees take you in without any formality and start treating you immediately. The staff is cheerful and cooperative (for the most part) and despite their lacklustre management information systems, they get the work done relatively quickly.
I’m an experience oriented person so I loved the hospital, but they did make a big blunder by misdiagnosing my friend’s fracture as a sprain. If you really care about your health, and have the money, best to get a second opinion too.

text:
I recently received treatment for my father at Apollo Hospital, BBSR and wanted to express my sincere gratitude for the exceptional care I received. From the moment I entered, the entire experience was positive.

The nurses were absolute angels. They were incredibly attentive, compassionate, and always went the extra mile to ensure patient comfort. Their kindness and positive attitudes truly made a difficult time much easier.

I would also like to commend Dr Paresh Kumar Jena for their expertise and professionalism. Dr Paresh Kumar Jena took the time to thoroughly explain my condition and answer all my questions in a way I could understand.  Their treatment plan was effective, and I felt confident in their care throughout my stay.

Overall, Apollo Hospitals, BBSR provided top-notch medical care in a supportive and professional environment. The dedication of the nurses and the expertise of Dr Paresh Kumar Jena made a world of difference in my experience. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Apollo Hospitals, BBSR to anyone seeking excellent medical care.
name: Khirod Rout
title: Apollo Hospitals

But because of that till now my father is suffering. Everytime we went there they insisted because of water dried out in eye he has issue. But now we came to know there must be a gap of 1 to 1.5 month between both eye operation. Pathetic Dr and assistant. If anyone wants proof I can give all screenshot of prescription. Worst hospital in bhubaneswar.

text: Myself Sushree Sangeeta Priyadarshini, admitted in KHL in D1 237 on 5/3/24. I was admitted through star health insurance with disease Lt Parovarian Cyst which was plan to be operated on 6/3/24. The insurance provided 20,000/- approval prior admission. After admission, there was a query send by insurance to hospital, regarding which I was completely unknown. There was no any counselling, no information from hospital insurance team. As a result I have to pay 1,13000 at tha time of discharge. And my approval was cancelled. This is completely for negligence of staff. Also I pay 1 day extra bed charge due to negligence of ward secretary. Madam advice discharge at 11am but my file was not ready till 3:30 pm. Is this the way to work. Apart from this all the services was very nice,. But think if someone admitted in insurance, but at the end time she/he had to pay 113000, how disgusting is this. Never want to visit here also never recommended any one. Poor counselling . And I am harrased completely after this mentally . Being a person in medical department, if I was treated like this and go through this condition then what about common people. I must say many people suffer like me . No one is ready to pay 113000 in 1hr for someone's negligence

text:
Dr. Mitali Kar Exceptional Neurologist
I rarely write reviews, but I feel compelled to share my experience with Dr. Mitali Kar, a remarkable neurologist. My 74-year-old mother suffered a severe brain stroke, and we rushed her to the nearest government medical college, MKCG. Unfortunately, the emergency doctors there neglected her, and we had no choice but to transfer her to Bhubaneshwar CARE. It was there that we were introduced to Dr. Mitali Kar, and little did I know what a blessing she would turn out to be.
Dr. Mitali took charge of my mother's case within two days of her arrival in the ICU. To my astonishment, my mother was transferred out of the ward after just eight days, and we were able to fly her to Hyderabad for further treatment.

Dr. Mitali is not only an expert in her field, but she also possesses an incredible amount of empathy and kindness. She goes above and beyond to ensure the well-being of her patients. I am grateful for her straightforwardness, as she addresses any issues with the hospital staff, be it related to food timings, hygiene, or any other concerns.

Despite being thousands of miles away in the United States, I am amazed at Dr. Mitali's dedication. Whenever I reach out to her regarding my mother's condition, she responds promptly, usually within five minutes. Her commitment to her patients and willingness to provide guidance and support are truly commendable.

I cannot thank Dr. Mitali enough for all that she has done for my mother's recovery. Although it will take time, I am confident that with Dr. Mitali's exceptional care, my mother is on the path to a successful recovery. She exemplifies the qualities that all doctors should possess – expertise, empathy, and a genuine commitment to their patients' well-being.

I highly recommend Dr. Mitali Kar to anyone in need of a competent and compassionate neurologist. She is a true lifesaver, and I am forever grateful for her exceptional care.
name: Manaswini Acharya
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

My fixed hospital henceforth.

text:
Overall a pleasant experience. Below are few points we liked and disliked :
Liked :
-Maintained hygiene
-Spacious room
-Supportive staff - the nurses and other staff were helpful. We specially appreciate Jharana Madam who helped a lot right from child birth to help feeding the baby properly and also gave some good advices on how to handle the new born. We really thank her for taking out some time each day for us even though she was occupied in the OT
-Food was good and eatable

Disliked :
-Room prices were too high - hospitals must look after affordability rather than focusing on business
-Unnecessary additional services were added, for example the dietician service ( we have elders in family to guide us on the diet and therefore this service should not be imposed as a mandatory service to avail)
-Doctor services were quite high considering the fact that they hardly visited each day and even when they visited it was just for few seconds. So the charges should be reduced and made affordable
name: priyanka lenka
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
My mother is diagnosed with lung cancer and currently her treatment is going on under the guidance of Dr Stithi Das,Senior Consultant, Radiation Oncologist.At this difficult time,we were lucky to have a compassionate,skilled and experienced doctor.During our consultation with Dr.Das,she not only took time to listen our problems carefully but also explained and treatment options in a way that was easy to understand.
She even referred us to other professional doctors like Dr.Sunil Jaiswal, Surgeon Oncologist and Dr.Prashant Kumar Parida, Medicine Oncologist which too gave us a sense of reassurance and confidence that immediately put us in ease.
We are very grateful to the entire team (Dr Stithi Ma'am,Dr.Sunil Sir,Dr.Parida Sir,Dr.Debjyoti Sir and Dr.Jayshree Ma'am)for their outstanding care and in-depth knowledge have instilled confidence in me.I would highly recommend others to consult.
Hope my mother get well soon .
Thank You
Lopamudra Mitra

text:
The reception call attaining staff have very bad culture. They talk in high and oppressive voice. No intention to help the patient. One of them (a lady) asked me to come to meet the doctor in between 10AM-5PM. When I asked to tell me a specific time when the doctor comes to his chamber for outdoor patients,  she shouted and reply with very high  voice that there is no such timings. If you want to meet the doctor then come and wait for as many as hours it will take and cut the phone immediately. If anyone from Kalinga Hospital is reading this comment please find such staffs who degrading the image of your hospital and tell them at least talk to patients with politeness. I am very much disappointed.

I called on 9.32AM (9 Feb 2024)
Call duration: 0 mins 57 secs
name: Abhishek Mishra
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

I wish I could give negative star. The worst management of the hospital. Very poor nursing service. At the time of billing, you will face problems like anything. It's a private hospital so patients pay money for each and every service but I don't understand, why do they behave like nonsense? It's a dual character hospital to loot the money.

text:
I recently visited Apollo Hospital and had the pleasure of being assisted by Ranjan Kumar Naik at the reception. From the moment I arrived, Ranjan's professionalism and warm demeanor stood out. He greeted me with a friendly smile and ensured that I felt welcomed and comfortable.

Ranjan was incredibly efficient in managing the check-in process, which was swift and hassle-free. He demonstrated a deep understanding of the hospital's procedures and was able to answer all my questions with clarity and patience. His attentiveness and willingness to assist were truly commendable.

What impressed me most was Ranjan's empathy and genuine care for the patients and their families. He went above and beyond to accommodate special requests and made sure that everyone received the necessary information and guidance.

Overall, Ranjan Kumar Naik exemplifies the high standards of service that Apollo Hospital is known for. His exceptional customer service skills and dedication to helping others make him an invaluable asset to the hospital. I am grateful for his assistance and highly recommend him to anyone visiting Apollo Hospital.

text:
**Very Disappointed with Renowned Hospital**

I recently spent 3 lakhs for a 3-day stay for surgery. Shockingly, there's no free post-surgery consultation for the first visit. They even charge 400 for stitch removal, that took 2-3 minutes. The management says it's because of the transition from AMRI to Manipal, It was there till AMRI but patients who joined under AMRI should still get free consultations. This feels like exploitation.

Requesting the management to address this and stop prioritizing profit over patient care.

title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text:
I have long run relationship with then AMRI and now Manipalhospitals. The gynacology department lead by Harpreet Kaur Madam along with the opd sisters and labour room,post Op room sisters and all official s are doing there service dedicatedly and they took care my wife's Lopsmudra Dash' situation with great care.

Now post my premature baby girl who has spent her intial 19 days with NICU, was really a overwheling in nature. Doctor Janaki Sir, Abhilipsa madam has taken great treatment which is good for my baby. I will never forget those daily counseling sessions, where evertime I wish to hear good things about my baby.

I will never forget the nicu sounds. The Nicu doctor Sashi sir took care and always share calming advice for my baby. The Nicu sisters are really giving round the clock, next to motherly treatment for my baby. Hospitals may be giving them salary for the service., but the service can't be ebalutaed with money. Me, my wife and my small baby really thanking eachone of you and I know, every time I used to convince you guys to just to see my baby face during non visiting hrs. Still you guys understood my emotions and gave support. I would like to name, Akankahya Sister, Mausumi Sister, Kadambini sister and sorry I don't know many sisters name, who gave great support and good care of my baby. The support I can not compensate with any monetary but really you guys doing extra ordinary work which is godly in nature. Thank you and request manipal to recognize there effort and share my token of appreciation to all the sisters of NiCU and labour room and post op sisters.

Thanks,
Rajesh and Lopamudra
Rudranshi(Lora) (Baby)
name: RAJESH KUMAR Mohapatra
title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text:
The radiology staff are terrible in communication. They mislead patient in a way which maximises wait and zero regard to our time.

Had I been instructed that the first 15 slots are reserved for inpatient and OPD have to wait till 12 noon, I could have done my ultrasound at a diagnostic center which provides better service.

Instead we were instructed to arrive early next day at 9 am and be in queue which we duly complied and then we ce to know of what really happens.

Made my very angry. The issue is not the wait, the issue was misleading and poor communication.

Hope the staff are trained to provide the worst case scenario, instead of giving best case scenario while scheduling.

text: These crooked killers couldn't even cure my dad's malnutrition and weakness due to chemo, and instead introduced unnecessary nuero medicine into his body to cure his headaches which resulted in my dad stopped talking and slowly stopped responding to ours' words. My dad stayed at this miserable evil spirited sunshine hospital for 8-10 days and they still couldn't figure out why my dad's condition never improved even after over a dozen tests. text:
My Observation
1)- Doctor had not seen any report of My patient before OT & my father was taken to OT.
I waited for about 45 mins outside OT, then my patient was taken inside so i came out of there, but after 15 mins received a call from OT that doctor wanted to talk to me. After talking to doctor he said- i hadnot seen your patients report earlier, now i after seeing reports i found some cancerous like thing in MRI, so we should not operate now, lets do a Biopsy 1st then after getting biopsy report we can operate.

I just wonder how could a surgeon decide & take patient inside OT before seeing any diagnosis or reports & cancel OT even after taking patient inside ???
My father is 73 years Old and in this Hot summer He was kept without food & water since 12 AM before OT and at the End moment OT was cancelled

2- OT time was not decided or informed so i went to Nursing station & asked about time, one of the nursing staff was asking me that- is there any OT today ?? Isn't it their Negligence that they don't even knew on 18th OT was there..
3 :- Before any OT procedure PAC must be done but in my fathers case no PAC was done & patient was taken to OT how could it be possible ??

4. In stay of 2 days in Hospital no Doctor visited my patient.
Even If Dr. Priyabrata Das was Busy In Transplant Case his Assistant must have to visit my patient.. Also i didn't see the treating Doctors concern towards my patient, that was very Pathetic.

This was really  a very Bad experience in Sum Ultimate

Other facilities are excellent but the concern doctor and your nursing staffs need be more professional.
name: Dillip Panigrahi
title: SUM Ultimate Medicare - Best Multispeciality Hospital in Bhubaneswar

text:
I've really had a bad experience with the regular check ups for my mom at Cardiology Div. of Sum Ultimate Medicare.
They made us wait the whole day saying the doctors were busy and asked us to come the next day.
And the next day we waited from the morning and could see patients who came after us already getting consultation before us.
Really didn't expect such incompetence from such a "Renouned" Hospital.
Their Manangement is laughable.
They don't even have a schedule system through which you could atleast time your meet with the doc.
It's a wild goose chase here, If you ask how much time is it gonna take for your turn, they say just wait, don't you see others are waiting as well..
Thank You for your service
Hat's off to the Sum Ultimate Management.

text:
My warning to all the people who are planning to visite this hospital i will suggest please dont go because its not a hospital it is way to death Some day before i admited my mother in this hospital she was patient of burning case 1st 12days they kept in ICU and just playing with us as we have corporate insurance they are just giving bill there is no much treatment done by hospital end and my mom also recoveing slowly then when we asked them for better treatment we want to take second opinion suddenly they told that will kept operation and remove dead cells and infection of burning along with removing of 3 finger my mom was not ready so we convinced her then before operation they didn’t informed us that my mom having any complications like low blood pressure or anxiety and  asthma then after operation Dr. Unmesh Kumar Jena. Told she is out of danger and everything fine then suddenly at night they called and informed patient bp level is down we need blood at night 2 we arranged blood also from morning her blood pressure is now around 110/20 but still they kept in ventilation and there is no proper medication and precautions taken and no such measure action also not taken and around evening when my brother visit to my mom she was fully swollen and getting bleed then immediately he informed that doctor who ic in charge the check the ecg and the report are negative there is no heart beat at all and they declared my mom as she is no more and when we tried to call Dr unmesh kumar jena he is not picking up out calls the next day they handover body for postmortem when we asked him the reson behind the death he is telling we dont no what a ridiculous responsehe have given such a waste doctor he is never ever go to this hospital my kind request its not a hospital its a jail and worse the hell i lost my mom she is just 48 yrs only i lost my everything because of carelessness of these doctor and their plans towards getting more money they can make this operation long back when infection is spreading they delay or else they didi at that time when patient is not capable of facing  operation just hate this hospital
The main culprit of all these is the head of critical care Arun kumar he did everything well planned and to harassing patients and their family playing with family emotions really such a worst hospital never ever go to that hospital

Very very bad experience.. never ever trusted
name: anita ashwini

text:
We recently  visited Apollo Bhubaneswar to consult Dr. Satyabrata Dash, although he's a very good doctor but the experience with the hospital is horrible.
1. This hospital in no manner looks like a corporate or private hospital, the billing counter ladies are pathetic in terms of their behavior. They try to show us it's your fault that you chose to be sick they way they talk.
2. They don't  allow bookings on app or via website for the doctors stating that they cannot decide on the time taken by him for each patient. Entire hospital knows he takes 30 mins per patient, however they just overbook his appointments.
3. For an OPD appointment given at 10 am the doctor was available at 4 pm. There is a huge waiting time unnecessarily. And the billing guys fake it.

Overall- consider Apollo again if you have enough time and money to waste.
name: Anshuman Sahoo
title: Apollo Hospitals

text:
Apollo Hospitals is a well-known healthcare network in India and internationally, known for its high standards of medical care and advanced technology. Patients and families often praise the hospital for the following aspects:

1. **Experienced Medical Staff**: Apollo Hospitals employ some of the best doctors, surgeons, and specialists, many of whom have received international training.

2. **Advanced Technology**: The hospital is equipped with state-of-the-art medical equipment and offers a range of advanced diagnostic and treatment options.

3. **Comprehensive Care**: Apollo Hospitals provide a wide range of services, from routine health checks to complex surgeries and specialized treatments in areas like oncology, cardiology, neurology, and more.

4. **Patient-Centric Approach**: Many reviews highlight the hospital's focus on patient care, including attentive nursing, personalized treatment plans, and a supportive environment.

5. **Accreditations and Awards**: Apollo Hospitals have received various national and international accreditations, including JCI (Joint Commission International) and NABH (National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare Providers), which are indicators of quality care.

6. **Infrastructure and Facilities**: Patients often appreciate the modern infrastructure, clean facilities, and availability of amenities that enhance comfort during hospital stays.

However, like any large healthcare institution, reviews can vary, and some patients may experience longer wait times, higher costs, or communication issues. It's always recommended to research and consult with healthcare providers to find the best fit for specific medical needs.
name: Pabitra Behera
title: Apollo Hospitals

text:
Dear Concerned Person,
I had a very disappointing experience today with Sum Ultimate. I called multiple times to report an issue, but every time I was asked to provide my UMR number and email ID. The person who answered the phone told me that the staff member on duty had already finished their shift. Should I continue to face this? If you are charging a premium price, you should also ensure customer satisfaction. You are considered the best in Bhubaneswar, but to maintain that reputation, it's essential to keep your customers happy.

text:
Hi Subhas,
(Subhas Chandra Pujari, Physiotherapist, Manipal Hospital, Bhubaneswar)

I was suffering from awful pain in the joint of my right shoulder. After doctor consultation, the doctor had recommended for physiotherapy.

I started the physiotherapy in Manipal Hospital Bhubaneswar. My sessions were incredibly beneficial over there. My therapist Subhas has immediately made me feel at ease discussing my issues and was able to help identify and dissect the background or root cause to my problems.
I have been very impressed with the progress we have made with my right shoulder over the last couple of days. The improvement is much better than I could have hoped for. Your behaviour towards the patients is very polite and respectful. I would have no hesitation in recommending your services to people in similar circumstances if they ever require physiotherapy.

Thanks a lot Subhas, wishing you all the success and achievements in your life. God bless!

Tanushree Kamila
name: Tanushree Kamila
title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text:
As you reach the Utkal Hospital, the first struggle starts with finding a suitable parking space. Inside the hospital boundary, there are only few parking space, so one has to park on the road side (at times right next to the No parking sign.
As you manage to enter, visual displays are so poor, it is difficult to find out which counter is for what.
Went to get an endoscopy done, after discussions (with the people on the billing counter, who apparently had no clue about the process or resource availability), paid the amount (which is one the costliest hospital of the city). It could not be done on the day, as one need to have about 4 hours after breakfast, so went next day at the time (as told by the 'person' in the department), waited for one and half hour (as the Doctor - only one Berhampur / Cuttack educated gastro, has just gone for a round and will be back soon - continued ..).
Finally decided to cancel the process, got (luckily) the refund (after another round of wait in another set of counters).
name: Arun Kumar Paul
title: UTKAL HOSPITAL

text:
1=An online appointment system with the doctors may be developed to avoid frequent no answer to calls causing disappointment.
2=Prior appointment is required to be taken to consult some of the reputed doctors and patients are in queue. It has been experienced that some so called VIPs are rushing on the spot and consulting  for longer period without any appointment. This is causing irritation to other patients who are in queue.

text: I just wanted to pass on my sincere thanks to Dr Mitalee Kar of Care Hospital  in Chandrasekharpur Bhubaneswar. Her exceptional professionalism, care and treatment for my father, who was admitted to care hospital for a few days, made a huge difference in his recovery.  Dr Kar's personal touch, her constant monitoring of my father's health and even during the follow-up check ups, was a great example and should set the benchmark for any hospital. In addition,  even other professional staff of Care Hospital were extremely helpful all through the process -- Jitendra Sarangi, Mangal Sahu and Swati Samal to name a few. All I can say is that our experience at Care Hospital was one of the best we have had all these years across all hospitals we have visited. Keep up the great service! Bests
name: Sambit Mohanty
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
I got root canal treatment from Dr. Sauvik Singha, Care Hospital Bhubaneswar.

Thank a lot.

text:
Good doctors, in-patient staff is good, CICU nurses are very good and caring. My father was very happy with them. Now coming to opd process, it is one of the worst. No appointment rules followed, took appointment at 2.30 was scheduled at sl. 2, till 3.30 could see the doctor and more then 7 patients went in. Parking is another problem, no proper facility for such a big infrastructure.
Reduce another star.Reports are not in time. Came for OPD , the whole day wasted,  neither the doctor did any check up, nor got any test reports. Doctor opd fees was paid only for getting the test to be done. By the time tests are done doctor is gone. We came more than 100kms away. So the transport cost incurred is also waste. Again have to come to show the report and will have to pay for opd charges. Complete loot.
name: alok parija
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text: I recently checked up my mother to Cardiologist Dr. Mahendra Prasad Tripathy..I booked an appointment before 3 months.but still we had been in the queue like after 30 people.and the staffs are not helpful at all. They only prescribed different types of tests just for grabbing money from innocent patients..That Dr. Mahendra Prasad Tripathy is a fraud...I heard him that he said to his receptionist that ki or v test likho..ek doh likhoge toh ho chuka kaam...The worst hospitality and the worst hospital ever. Each and every test karwane ke liye baht wait karna padta hai because yahan doctors time par aate nahi hai and they are busy somewhere with doing makeup or something else.. treatment ke naam par bas loote hai logo ko...and this overall things which I have written in the above each and every lines are true...Maine khud ye sab chiz experience kiya hai...

Bed charges per day 8100, which type of bed you will provide?????

My request is government provided you free land because that time you promised to serve people so don't make it commercialized. And teach your 24/7 emergency doctor tp behave well infront of a patient

I was literally barking like a dog but she was in her dreams she couldn't hear my voice for straight 5 minutes, afte that she woke up and gave me medicines.( Haan Bhai mufat ka ac chal raha hai so jata hu , kisiko kya hi pata chalega)

NOW COMING TO OPD

The staffs are too polite and friendly to the patient.

The uncle from ultrasound ward is very cooperative.

Dr. Agasti is a good doctor and he is taking proper care of opd patients.

NOT RECOMMENDED FOR EMERGENCY SERVICES
OPD STAFFS ARE WELL TRAINED..

text:
This is the worst hospital in Bhubaneswar. The rating I am giving here is because of my past experience. The details I am sharing below

1. Attitude of the doctors/managers
The doctors here have only one goal and that is to extract money by exploiting patients. They dont explain the procedure of surgery neither do they tell about the expenditure. Simply they say that expenditure cant be estimated. After the patient is admitted they will keep him/her unless they find another patient and they keep charging for the bed.
2. Cleanliness and hygiene
The hospital is not at all clean. The rooms are dirty. Even govt hospitals are far better in cleanliness. It is evident that they only want money for which they dont keep adequate no of employees for cleaning. With less staff they want the same work.
3. Skill of doctors
This I cant say about all doctors but the one who operated on my relative was not a skilled one.  After surgery he had to undergo minor surgery again at Kalinga Hospital. Still the problem persisted and now he needs to undergo surgery again.
4. Rooms
Very dirty rooms. There is only one remote for the entire block. Although there are different rooms there are no separate remotes. This caused too much problem. Sometimes the temperature goes down and sometimes goes up and everytime it was required to call the staff who become available after 10minutes after calling 3-4 times.
5. False bills
The doctors visit once everyday and put signature for visiting twice and charge for twice. At one instance he didnt visit even once and still charged for visiting twice. There is no way you can know the exact quantity of medicines and accessories used in any surgery. When I asked this they said that this is our policy. There is no way you can get help.
6. Medicine:
They sell medicine at MRP and don't provide any discount. Most patients go in emergency and they don't have time to go out to buy medicine. They have to spend more for this. This is gentleman's robbery.

Conclusion
This hospital is place where they rob people legally. I am not going there again.
name: iswar kar
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

text: Approached Utkal Hospital on an emergency on perforation of Gall Blader at 6pm. I was delighted to receive by Dr Gaurav Das, Senior Surgeon. I was in moribund condition and was in dire need of immediate attention. I was given very attentive focus from Dr. Das and my pre operative procedures were attended on priority and ontime. My operation was done on 20th April, and the process was seamless. Dr. Das along with his team were very cooperative and collaborative attending me and get this happen. I am really appreciative and spellbound to explain the way Dr. Das handled my case. Many thanks to him and God bless him and wish him all success in coming years. He is a great asset to Utkal Hospital.

text:
1 to the hospital service operations.. 5 to Dr. Utkal Kishore Diabetes specialist.

We had booked last 3 slots on Saturday till 4:45pm. We started updating to the hospital reception from 4:13pm onwards saying we will be delayed and will reach by 5pm and they said ok without any hesitation. And we have called them 3times since then,   till 5:00pm..

we reached at 5:01pm and they said ***VERY CASUALLY***, that they couldn't reach to the doctor's  reception desk or couldn't reach to the doctor.

The sad part is the hospital's reception staffs don't bother/care about the patients and their family.

Let me tell you,

It's not just one patient.. there were 3 appointments. They drove all the way from bolangir (345km) and now they have to return back)

It's very sad..

I would expect the management would take necessary action .

Because I don't see there could
be any technical issue in CARE hospital. I am sure the reception desk would have at least doctor's contact details or any sort of medium to send the message across to the doctor's desk.

text:
My father in law was suffering from knee pain and was unable to walk. We were planning for bilateral knee replacement for him. But were scared by listening to few people who earlier had knee replacement in different hospital and were facing complications. I heard about Dr Sandeep Singh, Orthopedic Surgeon at Care Hospital. We went for his consultation. He very clearly made us understood the entire procedure and assured us about the success of his past surgeries. We trusted his confidence and went for bi-lateral knee replacement on 18th of August 2021. Yesterday we went for review almost 47 days after the procedure. My father-in-law is completely all right and walked along the steps of the hospital. We are very happy. Thanx Dr Sandeep Singh who gave us confidence and did a wonderful job. He is quite friendly. He responds every query over whatsapp or call, in need.
Care Hospital, Bhubaneswar is a very good hospital, the staffs are very friendly and supportive. Well equipped hospital with credible doctors and facilities.
name: sambit nanda
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
It's all money and no service hospital. The semi private rooms are in pathetic condition. The beds have matresses that will give you nightmare, the sheets are dirty and if you ask them to change it, they make a face and get you another sheet which is also poorely maintained. In 24 hours no one came to clean the washroom, when we specifically asked for, one person came flushed the toilet and said it's cleaned (my mom and I laughed at it for hours, couldn't help 😅).

Let's come to doctors and the charges, they put arbitrary charges on your bill. Oh btw, there is no difference better assistant and a senior doctor because apparently they charge same for both (should I pity the condition of senior doctors or should I pity my own bank balance). Now, here comes the cherry on cake point, if the doctor is called on phone to ask if the patient should be admitted or not, that call will be regarded as a Consulataio call and you will be charged fully for it. When asked, why is it charged twice, I was informed that because 2 calls were made (nope I am not even kidding).

Further, when I wanted to know reports and levels of my parents, the doctor said why do you want to know the levels? What will you do by knowing it. Don't you trust us? Ummm hello....... Right to information about health about my parents?
name: richa agrawal
title: UTKAL HOSPITAL

text:
Dr. S. S. Jena of CARE Hospital is a good neurologist  and good human being  twith  empathy which is a critical ingredient in the make up of a good doctor.  Professionally competent and  open to academic interactions.

Only desirable thing is improvement of infrastructure.  I was in  Room No. 609 for  four days . The  basin tapes need change. The  spray of water from
slightest press would  wet the  shirt.  Sound from other rooms & corridor very  disturbing at night.  Nursing staff good in general. However,  the  nurse  who fixed the  IV   for  injections   on 10th  October  morning shift in my left arm needs re-training . I still have  swelling and  acute problems  due to defective  fixing of  the  IV . The  lady nurse on eleventh night took it out and  saved me from
acute pain.  My   MRI, MRA . Good, friendly technician  / radiologist.  Not happy experience at ultrasound.  No attached toilet. General toilet  so bad, so dirty that  could not have been worse. One would be reluctant  to
step into the  dirty toilet. How can retention be tested ?  The  corridor in front of the  Echo room overcrowded.  Dangerously  unsafe because hardly anyone  was wearing  masks  properly.  Flow of  people into  narrow  corridors  should be  regulated.
name: Rajanikanta Misra
title: CARE Hospitals, Bhubaneswar | Best Hospital

text:
AMRI is one of the best hospital in the city with fastest medical services. The hospital is very clean and has a good ambiance with clean cafeteria and inhouse food stores. Being the best we decided to go through my parents Kidney transplant at AMIR. My father was under medical guidance by Doctor Sukanto K. Das and Subodh Das. They underwent the surgery on 15th of May, 2024. And after due surgical intervention they were shifted to the KIDNEY TRANSPLANT UNIT (KTU) for post surgery care. The nursing staff at KTU namely Aiswarya, Susmita, Arundhati, Sunil, Subha and Monali are very attentive and have advised us for necessary Post surgery care at home.
We sincerely thank the concerned surgeons and their staff for their sincere devotion ensuring speedy recovery of my parents.
name: R SUBHADA MOHANTY
title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text:
Very very grateful to uh sir.What shall I say about Dr. Soumya Ranjan mohanty .Such a humble Physiotherapist with a heart of compassion and love. I took my Mom aged 53 to Amri hospital because she had a communited fracture in her
shoulder joint for which she developed post operated stiffness.she faced lots of difficulty  In doing daily activities. He listened to her politely . He then treated her so gently and gave proper home exercise regimen which cured her in a short span of time. By following his instructions now my mom is able to do most of her daily activities without feeling any discomfort
He is the first one who comes to my mind always for any problems related to Shoulder. Can’t thank enough to Amri Hospital for having such an  excellent Physiotherapists. The reputation grows higher for such hospitals by these kind of Physios  who is almost like a God at times when you go through pain. Thank you so much Doctor. _ Writing on my mom’s behalf.

Aliva Alakananda
name: aliva alakananda
title: Manipal Hospitals, Bhubaneswar

text: I landed at bhubaneswar on 29th April from Michigan, USA for my ACL surgery. I was admitted to Appollo bhubaneswar on 1st of May 2024. My surgeon was Dr. Sandeep Biswal, in my opinion he is one of best orthopaedic surgeons that I have ever encountered with. That's the reason I preferred Apollo bhubaneswar over hospitals in the USA. The services at Apollo bhubaneswar always been top rated as compared to other private and government funded hospitals. They take care of their patients extremely well. From cleaning to food to emergency care, in every segment Appollo bhubaneswar has achieved the premium standard. Many cheers to my personal medical assistant Sangita, Baisakhi and all other unsung hero's who took care of my during my stay.

text:
Dr Satyabrata Das ଜଣେ ଏମିତି ଡାକ୍ତର ମୁଁ ମୋ ଜୀବନରେ ଦେଖି ନାହିଁ,ମୋ ଭାଇ ର Adinocarcinova କ୍ୟାନ୍ସର ହେଇଥିଲା ,dr  Satyabrata Das କହିଲେ ,Young(28 ବର୍ଷ )pila achhi bhala Heijiba kichhi asubidha heba nahni Mumbai ru bhala doctor ଆସୁଛନ୍ତି (Dr Mahesh Agrawal & Dr R B Raju ) (Anaesthesia Doctor ) Mumbai Dr leproscopy ର ଭଲ ଡକ୍ଟର surgery pare recovery chance ଅଧିକ,ମୋ ଭାଇ କୁ 06-05-24 Monday dina Morning 7 taru ot ku nele ,aau surgery sarila rati 7.30 re ,mun sedina bi shock thili ete samaya surgery hue nahni boli ,semane sei surgery ସମୟରେ ମୋ ଭାଇ କୁ ମାରିଦେଇଛନ୍ତି ,ପରେ ନେଇକି MICU ରେ ରଖିଲେ ,MICU ରେ ରହିଥିବା ଡାକ୍ତର ମାନଙ୍କୁ କିଛି ଜଣା ନାହିଁ,ସେମାନେ ବୋଧେ ଟଙ୍କା ଦେଇକି ପଶି ଯାଇଛନ୍ତି,2 ଦିନ ଭାଇ MICU ରେ ରହିଲା ପରେ ,ବୁଧବାର ଦିନ ଆମକୁ କହିଲେ ଆପଣଙ୍କ ଭାଇ ଙ୍କର ରିପୋର୍ଟ ରେ କୌଣସି ତ୍ରୁଟି ଆମେ ପାଉ ନାହୁଁ,ତାଙ୍କର ବଞ୍ଚିବାର ଚାନ୍ସ ବହୁତ୍ କମ୍ , ତା ପରେ ଆମକୁ ଡାକିଲେ ଆଉ କହିଲେ ତୁମ ଭାଇ ଆଉ ଏଇ ଦୁନିଆରେ ନାହାନ୍ତି।ଡକ୍ଟର ଙ୍କୁ କହିଲି ଆପଣ କଣ କଣ medicine deichhanti taku tara report diantu ,semane Amaku kounasi report dele nahni ,apana ଭାବନ୍ତୁ,ଆପଣ ଏଠିକୁ ଆସିବେ ନିଜର ଜୀବନ ବଞ୍ଚାଇବା ପାଇଁ କିନ୍ତୁ ନିଜର ଜୀବନ ହାରିକି ଯିବେ ।ଆପଣ ମାନଙ୍କୁ Request karuchhi ei medical re thiba doctor mane ବିଶ୍ୱାସ ଯୋଗ୍ୟ ନୁହେଁ ।ଦୟାକରି ଏହି ଜାଗାକୁ ଆସିବା ପୂର୍ବରୁ ନିଜର ମତାମତ ଦେଇ ପ୍ରଥମେ ପଚାରନ୍ତୁ,ସେମାନେ ଆପଣଙ୍କର ଲୋକକୁ ଭଲ କରିଦେବେ ବୋଲି ଲେଖିକି ଦେବେ ତା ପରେ ଆପଣ ସେହି ଜାଗାରେ surgery karantu ।
Utkal Hospital re thiba doctor mananku Proper Treatment jana nahni ,kebala tanku tanka darakar.MICU re thiba Dr Archana nkara ସେତିକି ଜ୍ଞାନ ନାହିଁ ଯେ ସେ MICU ରେ ରହିବା ପାଇଁ ଜଣେ ଯୋଗ୍ୟ ଡାକ୍ତର ଭାବରେ ବିବେଚିତ ହେବେ।ଯଦି ଆପଣଙ୍କୁ ଲାଗୁଥିବ ମୁଁ ମିଛ କହୁଛି ବୋଲି ।ଏଇଟା ପୁରା ସତ୍ୟ ଘଟଣା ,ଆପଣ ଏଇ ଜାଗାକୁ ଯିବେ ଭଲ ହେବା ପାଇଁ କିନ୍ତୁ ଆସିବେ ଶବ ହେଇକି ।ଏଇ ଜାଗାରେ କେବଳ ଟଙ୍କା ଲୋଭରେ ଆପଣଙ୍କୁ treatment pain ହଁ କହୁଛନ୍ତି ,ରୋଗୀ ମରୁ କି ବଞ୍ଚୁ ତାଙ୍କର କିଛିବି ଫରକ୍ ପଡୁ ନାହିଁ।
name: Pabitra Kumar Majhi
title: UTKAL HOSPITAL

text:
Super bad Hospital.doctor is very causal.Recently I faced with an accident in which there is a sever fracture in my knee.In The great Kalinga Hospital. A young doctor of Orthopedic department after seeing my Xray report which has done in Kalinga hospital itself told nothing has done and its a normal case...and prescribed me normal medicine for 10 days.After 10 days my condition getting worsen.Then we consult with DR RK Mohapatra.He checked the same Xray report and told there is a Sever fracture in your Knee how you survived 10 days.  Immediate operation has done and now I am OK.

So I suggest all avoid Kalinga Hospital.
In this birth I will never enter Kalinga Hospital's gate.
name: Chinmayananda Senapati
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

text: Recently my father was admitted in kalinga hospital , he had a brain hemorrhage, he had under gone surgery , as per the doctor the surgery was successful , but he had a  infection, as a result the blood got infected and they did dialysis , but it did not improve his condition. at the end the result was we got a bill nearly 6 lakhs and my father was dead. i was standing at his death bed and tried to play the hare krishna hare ram songs in a mild sound as that was his favorite mantra. but the visiting hour was from 11 am to 12 pm and they allow only one person. since my father can pass at any moment , i was standing there beyond 12 pm and played the music , in the mean time the security guard came and told me go out of this place , i told him my father can pass at any moment but still he did not listen and i did not argue much at this point and i came out , after half an hour the heart bit of my father stopped. what kind of people this hospital has , if they simply do not allow us to stand near a dying person and play some sacred mantra. I encourage every one to get all the details , the data of successful surgery , the cost to be incurred before getting admission into this hospital. It was our first and last interaction with the hospital staffs . our family member will never enter into this hospital again. If you care for your family never ever get admitted in this hospital.
name: Prema Lata Patra
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.

text: ସମ୍ ଅଲ୍ଟୀମେଟ ହସ୍ପିଟାଲ ଆମ ଓଡିଶା ପାଇଁ ଏକ ଅଭୂତପୂର୍ବ ଆଶୀର୍ବାଦ। ସ୍ୱାସ୍ଥ୍ୟ ସେଵା କ୍ଷେତ୍ରରେ ଏହି ଅନୁଷ୍ଠାନଟି ର ଅବଦାନ ଉଲ୍ଲେଖନୀୟ ଓ ଅତୁଳନୀୟ ହୋଇପାରିଛି। ଏହା ଆମ ଅନୁଭୂତି ରୁ ଆମେ ଅନୁଭବ କରି ପାରିଛୁ । ପ୍ରଭୁ ଜଗନ୍ନାଥ ଙ୍କ କୃପା ରୁ ଆମେ ଆମର କଠିନ ସମୟ ରେ, ସଠିକ୍ ସ୍ଥାନ ରେ ପହଞ୍ଚି  ପାରିଥିଲୁ। ଯାହା ଦ୍ଵାରା ଆମର  ଉପଯୁକ୍ତ ଚିକିତ୍ସା ବ୍ୟବସ୍ଥା ସମ୍ଭବପର ହୋଇପାରିଥିଲା। ଚିକିତ୍ସାଳୟ ର ସମସ୍ତ ସଦସ୍ୟ ଏକ ଏକ ଜାଜ୍ବଲ୍ଯମାନ ହୀରକ ସଦୃଶ ।ସେମାନଙ୍କ ଅମାୟିକ ବ୍ୟବହାର ସଦା ଚେଷ୍ଟିତ ଥିଲା ଆମ ମୁହଁରେ ଟିକେ ହସ ଫୁଟାଇବା ପାଇଁ,ଯାହା କି ଆମ ପାଇଁ ଅତ୍ୟନ୍ତ ହୃଦୟସ୍ପର୍ଶୀ ଥିଲା। ଏଭଳି ଏକ ଅନୁଷ୍ଠାନ ର ପ୍ରତିଷ୍ଠାତା ଓ କର୍ମକର୍ତ୍ତା ଙ୍କ ପ୍ରତି ଆମେ ଆମର କୃତଂଜ୍ଞତା ଜ୍ଞାପନ କରିବା ସହିତ ସଂସ୍ଥା ଟି ର  ଉତରୋତ୍ତର ଉନ୍ନତି କାମନା କରୁଛୁ। ଜୟ ଜଗନ୍ନାଥ ।

text: My father has been admitted for kidney dialysis since 5 days. Doctor being a known face to us also not visiting my father for further check up. In these 5 days, doctor has not visited him for a single day.  Whenever we are asking for doctor, they simply promising us to visit, but all in vain. These guys are just sucking our money and time. Is this the way to take care of a patient in hospital. When patient need treatment, they get admitted to hospital. No one wants to stay in hospital with happiness. You guys don't have any idea how you people are ruining patient's self confidence and what my mother is going through being in hospital with my father. She has been approaching you guys for sending doctor for check up. But, I guess your doctors are in festive mood. Hell to that doctor. Being a doctor he must know his duties. Hope today everything'll be finalized else we'll take strong action against you for depressing my parents mentally.
name: Ananya Ojha
title: Kalinga Hospital Ltd.
